Mike Pence said he made the final decision not to run for president Wednesday night. He and his wife told their two daughters and then called their son, who is in college, early Thursday. We just concluded that while we could seek the presidency, we concluded that our best opportunity to continue to serve the people of Indiana was either in Washington, D.C., or here at home, Mike Pence said. be open to cutting Social Security benefits. Sen. Bernie Sanders said Barack Obama should have expected Erskine Bowles and Sen. Alan Simpson would recommend raising the retirement age. The commission issued a final proposal in December that called for increasing the retirement age to 68 by 2050 and to 69 by 2075.
